CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Total Energy Generated stage positioned above or below the Post-Generation stage?
SRP.A: The Total Energy Generated stage is positioned {above} the Post-Generation stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Distribution?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Distribution is {8835}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Generation?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Generation is {41062}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Total Energy Generated, with a value of {58421}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Post-Distribution, with a value of {8835}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Post-Transmission to stage Post-Distribution?
SC.A: Decreased by {14333} Megawatt Hours from stage Post-Transmission to stage Post-Distribution.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 16001? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Total Energy Generated} stage has {58421}, the {Post-Generation} stage has {41062}, the {Post-Transmission} stage has {23168}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 32115? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Post-Transmission} stage has {23168}, the {Post-Distribution} stage has {8835}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 16001 and 49741? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Post-Generation} stage has {41062}, the {Post-Transmission} stage has {23168}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Post-Generation to Post-Transmission, or from stage Total Energy Generated to Post-Generation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Generation} to {Post-Transmission} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution, or from stage Total Energy Generated to Post-Generation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Total Energy Generated} to {Post-Generation} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Total Energy Generated to Post-Generation, from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution, or from stage Post-Generation to Post-Transmission?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Generation} to stage {Post-Transmission} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Post-Generation} and {Post-Transmission} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Post-Transmission} and {Post-Distribution} stages.
